Test.Title: All Removable storage classes: Deny all access
Test.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
Test.Name: DenyAll

Test.Title: WPD-Devices: Deny write access
Test.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
Test.Name: DenyWrite

Test.Title: WPD Devices: Deny read access
Test.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
Test.Name: DenyRead

Test.Title: Removable Disks: Deny read access
Test.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
Test.Name: DenyRead

Test.Title: Removable Disks: Deny write access
Test.Description: By inserting a USB stick, the IPC can be infected with a malicious program. Therefore, it is recommended to deny access to various removable disks in the Group Policy settings. It is possible to either deny read and/or write access or to deny "any access".
Test.Name: DenyWrite

Test.Title: Set the default behavior for AutoRun
Test.Description: USB sticks and external hard drives may contain an autoplay file ("autorun.inf"). In this way, viruses, for example, could infect the system. The following table shows how to disable the Autoplay feature and AutoRun ("AutoRun Default Behavior" policy).
Test.Name: NoDriveTypeAutoRun

Test.Title: Turn off Autoplay
Test.Description: USB sticks and external hard drives may contain an autoplay file ("autorun.inf"). In this way, viruses, for example, could infect the system. The following table shows how to disable the Autoplay feature and AutoRun ("AutoRun Default Behavior" policy).
Test.Name: NoAutorun

Test.Title: Prevent removable media source for any installation
Test.Description: If it is not possible for you to prohibit access to USB media in general (see section 4.10), you should prevent software from being installed from removable media. This allows you to prevent malware or other unwanted programs from removable media from being installed on your IPC.
Test.Name: DisableMedia

Test.Title: Restrict the user from entering author mode
Test.Description: The graphical user interface "Microsoft Management Console" (MMC) is used to manage computers and users. You can configure if and how the MMC can be used. CAUTION With this setting you deny any IPC user access to the Microsoft Management Console! You may need to restart your computer if you want to make changes to Local Computer Policies or other settings in options that are already disabled (e.g. Control Center). Disable access to this console only if you are absolutely sure that the settings are complete and correct. Later change requests
Test.Name: RestrictAuthorMode

Test.Title: Restrict users to the explicitly permitted list of snap-ins
Test.Description: The graphical user interface "Microsoft Management Console" (MMC) is used to manage computers and users. You can configure if and how the MMC can be used. CAUTION With this setting you deny any IPC user access to the Microsoft Management Console! You may need to restart your computer if you want to make changes to Local Computer Policies or other settings in options that are already disabled (e.g. Control Center). Disable access to this console only if you are absolutely sure that the settings are complete and correct. Later change requests
Test.Name: RestrictToPermittedSnapins

Test.Title: Prevent restoring previous versions from backups
Test.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
Test.Name: DisableBackupRestore

Test.Title: Prevent restoring local previous versions"
Test.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
Test.Name: DisableLocalRestore

Test.Title: Prevent restoring remote previous versions
Test.Description: By disabling the recovery options of the operating system, it is no longer possible to return to previous states of the operating system. This prevents users from undoing changes to the system.
Test.Name: DisableRemoteRestore

Test.Title: Prevent indexing certain paths
Test.Description: To deny access to system paths (for example, "C:\Windows\system32"), you can explicitly specify which paths are excluded from the search.
Test.Name: file:///C:\*

Test.Title: Prevent indexing certain paths
Test.Description: To deny access to system paths (for example, "C:\Windows\system32"), you can explicitly specify which paths are excluded from the search.
Test.Name: file:///D:\*

Test.Title: Remove Search button from File Explorer
Test.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
Test.Name: NoShellSearchButton

Test.Title: No Entire Network in Network Locations
Test.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
Test.Name: NoEntireNetwork

Test.Title: Prevent access to drives from My Computer
Test.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
Test.Name: C:\

Test.Title: Prevent access to drives from My Computer
Test.Description: You can restrict access to drives to prevent manipulation.
Test.Name: D:\

Test.Title: User Account Control policy setting: Behavior of the Increased rights prompt for standard users
Test.Description: This function can be deactivated via the User Account Control (UAC). This means that a user with restricted rights no longer has the option of obtaining increased rights. Note Basically, you should only give your administrator passwords to authorized employees and otherwise keep them secret. This way you do not have to make this setting. This has the advantage that the admin can also make changes to the system without logging off the active user
Test.Name: ConsentPromptBehaviorUser

Test.Title: User Account Control: Run all administrators in administrator confirmation mode
Test.Description: This function can be deactivated via the User Account Control (UAC). This means that a user with restricted rights no longer has the option of obtaining increased rights. Note Basically, you should only give your administrator passwords to authorized employees and otherwise keep them secret. This way you do not have to make this setting. This has the advantage that the admin can also make changes to the system without logging off the active user
Test.Name: FilterAdministratorToken

Test.Title: Do not allow the system to shut down without logging in
Test.Description: With some operator stations it may be necessary to prevent the station from shutting down or to enable this option only for certain operators.
Test.Name: shutdownwithlogon

Test.Title: Prohibit User from manually redirecting Profile Folders
Test.Name: DisablePersonalDirChange

Test.Title: Disable Active Desktop
Test.Name: NoActiveDesktop

Test.Title: Prohibit deleting items
Test.Name: NoDeletingComponents

Test.Title: Prohibit editing items
Test.Name: NoEditingComponents

Test.Title: Disable desktop gadgets
Test.Name: NoSidebar

Test.Title: Hide Internet Explorer icon on desktop
Test.Name: NoInternetIcon

Test.Title: Remove Computer icon on desktop
Test.Name: HideIcons

Test.Title: Hide Network Locations icon on desktop
Test.Name: NoNetHood

Test.Title: Remove Properties from the Computer icon context menu
Test.Name: NoPropertiesMyComputer

Test.Title: Remove Properties from the Documents icon context menu
Test.Name: NoPropertiesMyDocuments

Test.Title: Remove Properties from the Recycle Bin context menu
Test.Name: NoPropertiesRecycleBin

Test.Title: Hide Recicle Bin icon on desktop
Test.Name: {645FF040-5081-101B-9F08-00AA002F954E}

Test.Title: Prevent adding, dragging, dropping and closing the Taskbar's Toolbars
Test.Name: NoCloseDragDropBands

Test.Title: Prohibit adjusting desktop toolbars
Test.Name: NoMovingBands

Test.Title: Remove Run menu from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoRun

Test.Title: Remove programs on Settings menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoSetFolders

Test.Title: Remove Pictures icon from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoSMMyPictures

Test.Title: Remove Download link from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoStartMenuDownloads

For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).

For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoStartMenuMyGames

For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoStartMenuNetworkPlaces

Test.Title: Prevent changes to Taskbar and Start Menu Settings
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoSetTaskbar

Test.Title: Remove Music icon from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoStartMenuMyMusic

Test.Title: Remove Network icon from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoStartMenuRecordedTV

Test.Title: Remove and prevent access to the Shut Down, Restart, Sleep, and Hibernate commands
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: HidePowerOptions

Test.Title: Lock the Taskbar
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: LockTaskbar

Test.Title: Remove Favorites menu from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoFavoritesMenu

Test.Title: Remove Search link from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoFind

Test.Title: Remove Network Connections from Start Menu
Test.Description: Menu entries such as "Search", "Games" or "Music" are normally not required and should be deactivated. For security reasons, "Printers" and "Network Connections" should also not be offered ("Disable Programs in Settings Menu" policy). Please note that some policies only deny access to the menu items. Some of the functions can be reached in other ways (e.g. under C:\Windows\system32).
Test.Name: NoNetworkConnections

Test.Title: Remove Change Password
Test.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
Test.Name: DisableChangePassword

Test.Title: Remove Lock Computer
Test.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
Test.Name: DisableLockWorkstation

Test.Title: Remove Task Manager
Test.Description: You can use the computer configuration to switch off the key combination <Ctrl+Alt+Del> for user logon. (Computer Configuration > Windows Settings > Security Settings > Local Policies > Security Options > Interactive Login: No STRG + ALT + ENTF required). Alternatively, you can use the user configuration to set which actions are possible when pressing <Ctrl+Alt+Del> (e.g. no access to Task Manager).
Test.Name: DisableTaskMgr

Test.Title: Prohibit access to Control Panel and PC settings
Test.Description: The Control Panel can be used to make unwanted changes to the system, such as network connections, uninstalling programs, etc. Access to the Control Panel should therefore be prevented
Test.Name: NoControlPanel

Test.Title: Turn off Internet File Association service
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoInternetOpenWith

Test.Title: Turn off the "Order Prints" picture task
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoOnlinePrintsWizard

Test.Title: Turn off Internet download for Web publishing and online ordering wizards
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoPublishingWizard

Test.Title: Turn off the "Publish to Web" task for files and folders
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoWebServices

Test.Title: Turn off the Windows Messenger Customer Experience Improvement Program
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: CEIP

Test.Title: Turn off Help Ratings
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoExplicitFeedback

Test.Title: Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoImplicitFeedback

Test.Title: Turn off Windows Online"
Test.Description: The denial of Internet access limits the possibilities for unwanted installation of malware on the IPC.
Test.Name: NoOnlineAssist

Test.Title: Remove access to use all Windows Update features
Test.Description: If system updates are performed automatically, an unwanted restart of the system may occur. You can prevent this by configuring Windows Updates not to run automatically.
Test.Name: SetDisableUXWUAccess

Test.Title: Configure Automatic Updates
Test.Description: If system updates are performed automatically, an unwanted restart of the system may occur. You can prevent this by configuring Windows Updates not to run automatically.
Test.Name: NoAutoUpdate

Test.Title: Do not allow passwords to be saved
Test.Description: To be able to use the remote desktop connection for a restricted user account (without administrator rights), the corresponding user must be added under "Select user...". You can use Group Policy to extend the settings for Remote Desktop Services. By default, the listed settings are not configured. To ensure a higher security of the connection, it is recommended to use the NTLM protocol and not to allow storing passwords. How to enable these options is explained in the section "Advanced Remote Desktop Settings".
Test.Name: DisablePasswordSaving

Test.Title: Set RD Gateway authentication method
Test.Description: To be able to use the remote desktop connection for a restricted user account (without administrator rights), the corresponding user must be added under "Select user...". You can use Group Policy to extend the settings for Remote Desktop Services. By default, the listed settings are not configured. To ensure a higher security of the connection, it is recommended to use the NTLM protocol and not to allow storing passwords. How to enable these options is explained in the section "Advanced Remote Desktop Settings".
Test.Name: LogonMethod

Test.Title: Disable powershell and command prompt unsigned scripts execution
Test.Description: Disable execution of scripts. This entry should be executed last to avoid problems.
Test.Name: EnableScripts

Test.Title: Disable powershell and command prompt unsigned scripts execution
Test.Description: Disable execution of scripts. This entry should be executed last to avoid problems.
Test.Name: ExecutionPolicy

Test.Title: Disable Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge
Test.Description: Function to disable Internet explorer
Test.Name: NotifyDisableIEOptions
